intro: Deutzia corymbosa var. purpurascens, commonly known as the purple-leaf deutzia, is a deciduous shrub native to China. It is characterized by its striking clusters of white to pink flowers that bloom in early summer. The leaves are ovate and have a distinctive purplish hue, especially in the autumn. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. This variety is often used in ornamental gardening for its showy blooms and colorful foliage.
